item.title: Tidyr goes big
item.description: Unlike dplyr, tidyr never had a system of backends. But big data needs tidying as much as small data. So I am happy to announce that the new package tidyr.big provides the first two backends for tidyr, Hive and SparkSQL. May your big data be squeaky tidy from now on. It’s still experimental software: check it out with a grain of salt.

item.title: Rzilla is for all R, big data and open source practitioners
item.description:
Hello everyone! I am happy to announce the creation of Rzilla, a resource for R users of big data and open source software. As of today, Rzilla includes:

  • a forum
  • a github organization with a number of useful repos
  • a package archive to facilitate the distribution of R packages.

The packages currently hosted are rmr2 (mapreduce in R), dplyr.spark.hive (dplyr backend for Spark and Hive) and quickcheck (randomized testing). Such selection is simple to explain. rmr2 is by far the runaway success among the RHadoop packages with more than 100K downloads in a single release and hasn’t received any loving commits since March 2015. I also know it in detail as I have written most of the code. dplyr.spark.hive is under active development and combines the simplicity of dplyr with the power of two big-data backends, Hive and Spark SQL. quickcheck is needed for running tests for the other two, but it is a general testing package for any R developer to use. Rzilla is work in progress. Your participation and help is needed!
